Fast food Halloween costumes
Food&Drink October 23, 2009 By: Devon Lantry Tweet 0 Email Get Restaurants alerts! E-mail * do not change Contact Email Contact Email2 Contact Url Subscribe to Blog Remember my Info Wendy's girl costume. Buy it at Yandy.com Photo credit: yandy.com
Make this Halloween different and exciting. Your lingerie witch costume is missing a spider web pasty, your sexy librarian outfit has a puke stain on the cardigan, and your red pleather dominatrix suit is ridiculously inappropriate. So switch it up! If you like to curl up with a good Wendy’s chili on a cold night, say thank you with free publicity for Wendy’s Inc. and dress up as the red haired Wendy girl. Even though Wendy is supposed to be a naïve nine year old sweetheart, Halloween unwritten rules give you permission to show just enough cleavage to get the guy with the sarcastic“this is my costume”t-shirt to make out with you in the Halloween party laundry room.
If you’re more of a chicken guy, dress up as Colonel Sanders. The lady’s always love a distinguished southern gentleman who uses a lot of Kentucky Fried Chicken themed pick up lines. Be careful though when taking this costume outside the premises of the party. Those green colored cocktails with the candy eyeballs go straight to your head and release all of those repressed childhood memories of trick or treating. So go ahead and stumble out into the street crying and try to join a kindergarten crowd of Cinderella’s and Power Rangers waiting at a doorstep for candy. But remember that even a sober Colonel Sanders gives off a subtle child molester-ish vibe, and nobody wants to spend a night in jail dressed up as Colonel Sanders and throwing up candy corn, pretzels, and cheap liqueur. Nobody.
Check out some fast food Halloween costume ideas below!
Advertisement Tweet 0 Email Print Report
Devon Lantry , Chain Restaurant Examiner
As a native San Diegan, and a man who loves a great fast food joint, Devon Lantry loves sharing his passion for the ins and outs of San Diego fast food on Examiner.com.

Comments
Washingtonian 2 years ago This article is the stupidest thing that I have ever read ... actually most of your articles are ridiculous. You should not be a writer.
reply Report sylvia 2 years ago Hey Washingtonian: I disagree, I think this guy is entertaining. I love his stuff. Regardless, though, I think you should keep nasty comments like this to yourself. You are stooping to a low you would be embarassed to tell your children about.
reply Report SanDiegan 2 years ago Hey, it's Halloween, not Tolstoy. Lighten up. Just like the holiday, it's all in good fun.
reply Report Eleanor 2 years ago thanks for the article, but that costume is just down right stupid.
reply Report
